DOC.brief_title: Comparison Successful Spinal Needle Placement Between Crossed Leg Sitting Position Traditional Sitting Position
DOC.detailed_description: Approval Ethical Committee Faculty Medicine Universitas Indonesia acquire prior conduct study . Subjects give informed consent enrol study . Subjects randomly divide CLSP Group cross leg sit position ( n=105 ) TSP Group traditional sit position ( n=106 ) . Non-invasive blood pressure ( NIBP ) monitor , eletrocardiography ( ECG ) , oxygen nasal cannula pulse-oxymetry set subject operation room . Baseline information record . Spinal anesthesia do anesthesiology registrars do 50 spinal anesthesia procedure explain protocol spinal anesthesia injection study ( avoid bias ) . Outcome measure number successful spinal needle placement first attempt , difficulty level landmark palpation injection , number needle-bone contact . Data analyze SPSS ( Statistical Package Social Scientist ) use Chi-Square test , Fisher Exact test , Kolmogorov-Smirnov test . Significance value use 5 % 80 % power .
DOC.criteria: subject age 1860 year old subject ASA physical status IIII plan undergo urology surgery spinal anesthesia Subjects explain study , agree enroll sign informed consent form uncooperative subject subject relative absolute contraindication spinal anesthesia ( coagulation disorder , thrombocytopenia , increase intracranial pressure , severe hypovolemia , severe heart valve disorder , local infection injection site , allergy toward local anesthetic agent , significant anatomical disorder spine , wound/scar lumbal area ) subject body mass index ( BMI ) > 32 kg/m2 Drop criterion : subject request drop study subject need emergency treatment spinal anesthesia procedure subject nine time redirect spinal needle ( failed spinal anesthesia procedure ) .
